option.name: content
option.value:
Commit message guide Commit messages
Clear commit messages make pull requests easier to review, and release notes easier to generate. The Blockly project uses conventional commits to help with this.
Each commit should have the format:
<type>: <description>
[optional body]
[optional footer(s)]
Note that the core Blockly repo has a commit linter to help enforce this. If your pull request has multiple commits, the linter will check the title. If it has a single commit, it will check that commit. It is best if both your individual commits and the pull request title follow these guidelines. Type
The type must be non-empty, and all lower case. The following is a list of accepted types.
chore For commits that complete routine/automated tasks such as upgrading dependencies. deprecate For commits that deprecate functionality. feat For commits that add new functionality to Blockly. fix For commits that fix bugs/errors in Blockly. release For commits that relate to the release of a new version.
Breaking changes
Commits that make breaking changes should append a ! after the type of the commit. Breaking changes are changes that may break developers using Blockly in their apps, causing them to have to do extra work.
For example: none fix!: return type of workspace.paste
Breaking changes could have any of the above valid types. Description
The description must be non-empty, and must be under 256 characters. Body
The body is optional. If it is provided there should be a blank line between it and the description. It must be broken into lines of no more than 256 characters.
Note that usually, it is advisable to put this kind of information in your pull request description, in addition to/rather than directly in the commit. Footer
The footer is optional. If it is provided there should be a blank line between it and the body. It must be broken into lines of no more than 256 characters. Fixing non-conventional commits
If you did not use conventional commits when making your modifications, there are two options for fixing the messages depending on how many commits you have:
If your pull request has multiple commits, edit the pull request title to conform to the requirements. When the pull request is merged, your other commits will be squashed so that the title becomes the commit message.
If your pull request has a single commit, amend your commit message using git commit --amend, then force push your changes to your fork of Blockly. This will automatically updated any open pull requests associated with this branch. git push --force origin my-branch.

list.name: 更改
list.comment:
feat: add PDF generation API and examples for bulk downloads
- Introduced `download-pdf-bulk.ts` endpoint to handle bulk PDF generation from card data. - Implemented `renderPdfBuffer` in `pdfHandler.ts` to render PDF documents with customizable highlights and formatting. - Added comprehensive examples for API usage in `examples/README.md`. - Updated dependencies to include `pdfkit` and associated libraries.

task.summary: Refactor input hint behavior and add initial project configuration
Add initial extra section for tagline and button in minimal mode

ft. improved group copying functionality and introduced accessibility updates
- Added keyboard accessibility for `.group-title` in `styles.css` and implemented click/keyboard events in `app.js`. - Refactored and modularized clipboard copying methods for better reusability. - Updated `.idea/workspace.xml` configurations with new task details and Git settings.

feat: add onboarding tutorial and improve accessibility
- Implemented an onboarding tutorial in `index.html` for new users, including step indicators, tooltips, and navigation controls. - Improved keyboard accessibility and updated copy icon SVG in `index.html`. - Introduced CSS variables for consistent spacing and border styles in `styles.css`. - Switched font to "Baskervville" for a refined appearance in `styles.css`. - Updated `.idea/workspace.xml` with new configurations and task details.

chore: remove unused code and debug logs
- Removed obsolete `liftMarkerOutOfHighlight` and `safeInsertFragmentAtRange` functions from `app.js`. - Deleted unnecessary `console.log` debug statements throughout `app.js`. - Improved code readability by cleaning up redundant comments and dead code.

feat: delay onboarding tutorial start and enable reset utility
- Modified onboarding tutorial logic to defer initialization until needed in `app.js`. - Added a global utility to reset onboarding progress for testing purposes via the browser console.

fix: defer onboarding tutorial init until after layout transition
- Moved onboarding tutorial initialization to execute after layout animations complete in `app.js`. - Adjusted timing to enhance user experience by ensuring animations finish before tutorial starts.

chore: remove `public/app.js` as it is no longer used
- Deleted `app.js` to clean up unused features and reduce project size. - Confirmed functionality is redundant or replaced in new implementations.

fix: balance `<HL>` tags to prevent rendering issues
- Added `balanceHLTags` method to ensure `<HL>` tags are properly paired. - Prevents over-highlighting caused by unbalanced or nested tags. - Refactored the rendering logic in `CardCutterApp.js` to use the new method.

fix: improve tag balancing and newline handling for highlights
- Enhanced `domToPositionData` and `rebuildDOMFromPositions` in `EditingPanel.js` to preserve newlines and improve tag stability. - Added `validateAndFixHLTags` in `cite.ts` to ensure proper `<HL>` tag pairing. - Updated `CardCutterApp.js` to integrate enhanced cleanup and evaluation logic. - Improved `config/prompts/card_cutter.json` to better define evidence citation rules.

fix: simplify highlight processing and remove newline handling
- Refactored `EditingPanel.js` to remove redundant newline handling logic. - Simplified `domToPositionData` and `cleanupStoredHighlightTags` by removing obsolete newline-related code. - Updated `CardCutterApp.js` to enforce single-line, `<HL>`-only content during cleanup and migration. - Added streamlined logic for tag balancing and merging to ensure stability.

feat: add comprehensive API documentation
- Created `API.md` to provide detailed documentation for all API endpoints. - Included usage examples, request/response formats, and complete workflows. - Updated `README.md` with a concise overview and link to the full documentation.

feat: add batch citation and document generation example
- Introduced `batch-citation-example.js` to demonstrate citing multiple sources and generating a single Word document. - Implemented citation handling with quality filtering and document generation highlighting alternate colors. - Provided a complete workflow for streamlined evidence citation.

MESSAGE.value: Refactor input hint behavior and add initial project configuration
Add initial extra section for tagline and button in minimal mode

ft. improved group copying functionality and introduced accessibility updates
- Added keyboard accessibility for `.group-title` in `styles.css` and implemented click/keyboard events in `app.js`. - Refactored and modularized clipboard copying methods for better reusability. - Updated `.idea/workspace.xml` configurations with new task details and Git settings.

feat: add onboarding tutorial and improve accessibility
- Implemented an onboarding tutorial in `index.html` for new users, including step indicators, tooltips, and navigation controls. - Improved keyboard accessibility and updated copy icon SVG in `index.html`. - Introduced CSS variables for consistent spacing and border styles in `styles.css`. - Switched font to "Baskervville" for a refined appearance in `styles.css`. - Updated `.idea/workspace.xml` with new configurations and task details.

chore: remove unused code and debug logs
- Removed obsolete `liftMarkerOutOfHighlight` and `safeInsertFragmentAtRange` functions from `app.js`. - Deleted unnecessary `console.log` debug statements throughout `app.js`. - Improved code readability by cleaning up redundant comments and dead code.

feat: delay onboarding tutorial start and enable reset utility
- Modified onboarding tutorial logic to defer initialization until needed in `app.js`. - Added a global utility to reset onboarding progress for testing purposes via the browser console.

fix: defer onboarding tutorial init until after layout transition
- Moved onboarding tutorial initialization to execute after layout animations complete in `app.js`. - Adjusted timing to enhance user experience by ensuring animations finish before tutorial starts.

chore: remove unused editing panel implementation
- Deleted the `EditingPanel` class and its related helpers from `app.js`. - Cleaned up color picker and text highlight management functions no longer in use.

chore: remove `public/app.js` as it is no longer used
- Deleted `app.js` to clean up unused features and reduce project size. - Confirmed functionality is redundant or replaced in new implementations.

fix: balance `<HL>` tags to prevent rendering issues
- Added `balanceHLTags` method to ensure `<HL>` tags are properly paired. - Prevents over-highlighting caused by unbalanced or nested tags. - Refactored the rendering logic in `CardCutterApp.js` to use the new method.

fix: improve tag balancing and newline handling for highlights
- Enhanced `domToPositionData` and `rebuildDOMFromPositions` in `EditingPanel.js` to preserve newlines and improve tag stability. - Added `validateAndFixHLTags` in `cite.ts` to ensure proper `<HL>` tag pairing. - Updated `CardCutterApp.js` to integrate enhanced cleanup and evaluation logic. - Improved `config/prompts/card_cutter.json` to better define evidence citation rules.

fix: simplify highlight processing and remove newline handling
- Refactored `EditingPanel.js` to remove redundant newline handling logic. - Simplified `domToPositionData` and `cleanupStoredHighlightTags` by removing obsolete newline-related code. - Updated `CardCutterApp.js` to enforce single-line, `<HL>`-only content during cleanup and migration. - Added streamlined logic for tag balancing and merging to ensure stability.

feat: add comprehensive API documentation
- Created `API.md` to provide detailed documentation for all API endpoints. - Included usage examples, request/response formats, and complete workflows. - Updated `README.md` with a concise overview and link to the full documentation.

feat: add batch citation and document generation example
- Introduced `batch-citation-example.js` to demonstrate citing multiple sources and generating a single Word document. - Implemented citation handling with quality filtering and document generation highlighting alternate colors. - Provided a complete workflow for streamlined evidence citation.

feat: add quick-start examples and enhance README documentation
- Added `quick-start.js` for a simple Evidex API example with interactive features. - Enhanced `examples/README.md` with detailed instructions for JavaScript and Python quick-start workflows. - Updated `README.md` with external service integration examples, including cURL and JavaScript usage.

feat: add PDF generation API and examples for bulk downloads
- Introduced `download-pdf-bulk.ts` endpoint to handle bulk PDF generation from card data. - Implemented `renderPdfBuffer` in `pdfHandler.ts` to render PDF documents with customizable highlights and formatting. - Added comprehensive examples for API usage in `examples/README.md`. - Updated dependencies to include `pdfkit` and associated libraries.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
feat: add PDF generation API and examples for bulk downloads
- Introduced `download-pdf-bulk.ts` endpoint to handle bulk PDF generation from card data. - Implemented `renderPdfBuffer` in `pdfHandler.ts` to render PDF documents with customizable highlights and formatting. - Added comprehensive examples for API usage in `examples/README.md`. - Updated dependencies to include `pdfkit` and associated libraries.
